result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Lauren Breckenfelder.  The State is not objecting to the competency report.  Defense counsel is ot objecting to the report but is contesting protective placement.  The court finds the DE incompetent and unlikely to regain competency within the statutory time limit.  The DE is ordered to be taken into custody and delivered to Winnebago.  Corporation Counsel to prepare paperwork undr either 51 or 55.  Proceedings are suspended.  Clerk D. Smith.
Report from State of Wisconsin Dept. of Health Services - dated 2/28/18
Hearing on March 16, 2018 at 10:30 am.
Competency report from Dr. Mark Phelps at Mendota Mental Health Institute.
Fax cover sheet from Dr. Phelps re competency report.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody from Mendota) with Atty Lauren Breckenfelder.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Report indicates def. is not competent but is likely to regain competency within the statutory period.  Time period runs from 3/31/17.  Competency hearing/status conf. set for 3/28/18 at 3:00.  Bond continued.
From State of WI Dept. of Health Services - dated 12/21/17

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Atty. Lauren Breckenfelder appeared on behalf of the DE who was not writted down from Mendota.  Minutes in CCAP, from 6/30/17 hearing, reference wrong judge & court reporter.  Correction was made.  Court is scheduling hearing in 3 months.  The DE only needs to be writted down for the hearing if there is a change in the report.  Competency hearing 1/11/18 @ 8:30.  Clerk D. Smith.
Minutes from 6/30/17 hearing reflect the wrong judge.  Therefore, the court official is being changed from Judge Schroder to Judge Bastianelli.
From WI Dept. of Health Services
Notice of hearing, mailed to Travis White, returned by USPS.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.
Competency hearing on October 6, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Per Judge Bastianelli, competency hearing scheduled for 10/6/17 @ 10:00.  Next report is due 9/30/17.
Copy of report sent to DA & Atty. Breckenfelder
From WI Dept. of Health Services - letter dated 6/30/17

of Commitment for Treatment
Form CR 206

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorneys Edwards and Breckenfelder.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Letters received from OCRP reviewed by the court indicating he is no longer a candidate for the program.  The court orders that the DE is remanded to custody and committed to Mendota Mental Health Institute.  The court contacted the admissions department at Mendota Mental Health and the admissions specialist indicated that there is availability if he will be taken this afternoon.  The DE is taken into custody and to be transported by the Sheriff's Department.
from Brooke E. Lundbohm, Psy.D., of the Outpatient Competency Restoration Program.  DE has been non-compliant with the program.
from Dr Brooke Lundbohm of OCRP
of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) CR-206.  Faxed to BCI/OCRP

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney L Breckenfelder.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State in victim compliance.  ADA Trigg stipulates to the report.  Based on stipulation of parties the court finds the deft is not competent but is likely to regain comptency w/n 12 months; commitment is for outpatient treatment.  Competency hearing continued to 6/30/17 at 8:30am; if no change in report the hearing will be set out another 3 months and notice sent.
From Courtney A. Andres, Psy.D.

14CF1487, 15CF828, & 16CF1068 - Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Lauren Breckenfelder.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Competency hearing that was scheduled for today is reset for 3/31/17 at 1:30 on all 3 files.  Defense expert's report to be filed by 3/10/17.  Bond continued.

14CF1487, 15CF828, & 16CF1067 - Atty Hilary Edwards represents def. in 15CF828; Atty  Edwards is out on medical leave.  Atty Lauren Breckenfelder is taking over 14CF1487 & 16CF1067 for Atty Andrea Rufo.  Atty Breckenfelder requests the competency hearing on 1/18/17 at 1:30 be changed to a status conference; no objection by ADA Emily Trigg.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo who advises they are requesting a contested competency hearing.  The doctor may appear by phone for the hearing onb 1/18/17 @ 1:30 (1 hr).  Bond cont'd.  Clerk D. Smith.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Andrea Rufo.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Defense expert is examining the def. as to competency (not court ordered), but examination and report are not completed.  Def. changed plea to not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Status conf. 11/11/16 at 8:45.  Bond continued.
Notice of Assignment for DE returned.No such number.  Unable to forward.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Travis W. White, appeared with Attorney Andrea K Rufo.  Clerk: PT
Atty Rufo states their office has retained an expert to conduct an evaluation on the DE and requests an adjournment.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Travis W. White, appeared in custody with Attorney Andrea K Rufo.  Clerk: PT
Atty Rufo moves to dismiss Count 2 and there is no objection by the State.  Count 2 is Dismissed on DE's motion.  Atty Rufo requests an adjournment as to Count 1 to allow her office time to complete an independent evaluation.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Travis W. White, appeared with Attorney Andrea K Rufo.  Clerk: PT
Atty Rufo requests an adjournment for an independent NG evaluation through the public defender's office; no objection by the State.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 09:40 am.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  14CF1487/15CF828.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hilary Edwards on behalf of Atty Andrea Rufo.  Parties ready to proceed.  Report has been received that the deft is now competent.  All parties concur with the findings in report including deft.  Court finds the deft is now competent to proceed.  Cases remanded to Intake court for preliminary hrg on 2/18/16 @ 10am.  Bonds to continue as previously fixed in each file.
from Mendota
Of Commitment for Treatment.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Andrea Rufo.  Report has been received; report states the deft is not competent at this time but is likely to regain competency w/in a one year period on the new charges (14CF1487 & 15CF828) and whatever time is remaining on the older file (12CF513).  All parties concur with this finding.  Proceedings are suspended and deft shall be committed for a period of one year on the new charges and the whatever time is remaining on 12CF513.  Atty Rufo will investigate the time remaining on the older file and report back to the court w/in a day.
from Mendota Mental Health Institute.
Further proceedings at 11-17-2015 03:00 pm (rescheduled - deft was not transported to Mendota in time to have hrg on 11/6/15)

For Competency Exam by Department of Health Services.

Copy to Atty & D.A

Minutes:  12CF513/14CF1487/15CF828.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Dr. Rawski appeared via telephone.  Brief discussion held with attys and Dr. Rawski.  Court orders a 15 day competency evaluation.  Based on the attached evaluations from Dr. Collins & most recently Dr. Rawski's evaluation, the Court strongly urges that an in-patient examination be done.  FP set for 11/6/15 @ 11am.

With respect to 15CF828 - no objection by any party to the court finding probable cause in this file; probable cause found.
Clerk Lehman spoke w/Dr. Rawski - he will be available via telephone on 10/19/15.

Minutes:  12CF513/14CF1487/15CF828.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Court did not render a decision on the appointment of an evaluation.  Court sets case over to 10/19/15 @ 3:30pm.  Court would like Dr. Rawski available via telephone to discuss procedural questions on for 2nd independent evaluation.

Minutes:  12CF513/14CF1487/15CF828.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Report has been received from the Wisconsin Forensic Unit; report states deft is not competent to proceed but is likely to become competent.  However, it is not clear on whether the restoration of competence should be outpatient or inpatient.  Brief discussion held.  Court decides to order an independent in patient evaluation.  Attys are invited to nominate an individual by 5pm on 10/2/15.  On Monday, the Court will make a decision on the appointment of the examiner.  Hrg will be held on 10/14/15 @ 11:30am.
from Wisc. Forensic Unit (corrected typo on last page)
from Wisconsic Forensic Unit
Defense counsel out ill; competency hrg adj to 9/30/15 @ 11am.  Email sent to all parties

Attorney Andrea K Rufo appeared.  Attorney James Steven Kraus appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: 12CF513 & 14CF1487. For reasons set forth on the record, matter adjourned. The Court orders a competency examination. Arguments heard on Atty Rufo's motion to dismiss Ct 2 in 14CF1487; so ordered.  Competency hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Rufo.  Report has been received from Dr. Collins.  All parties concur with Dr. Collins report.  Court finds the deft is not competent and not likely to become competent within the next twelve mos.  Court suspends the proceedings.  State shall forward documents to Corp Counsel.  Per 971.14(6b), deft is ordered to report to the Court in 6mos for re-evaluation of his competence.  FP set for 8/6/15 @ 1:30pm
